author: _shemnon
content: Jumpdests are very useful for static contract analysis. Each "run" can only start at a jumpdest rather than literally any code location. That can allow for pre-execution optimizations such as only incrementing gas at the exit of a run (or branch point with jumpi).  It can be done without jumpdests, but the analysis is much easier and bug resistant if they are there.

author: gcolvin
content:
<@!403707149043105803>  This EIP would do away with JUMPDEST, sort of.
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3690

author: _shemnon
content: Jump tables are just as useful for run analysis.  Is geth and solidity on board?
